## DASI vs ASSIST

When it comes to the study of substance use, two notable instruments employed by researchers are the Drug, Alcohol and Self-Injury Questionnaire (DASI) and Alcohol, Smoking, and Substance Involvement Screening Test - Substance Use (ASSIST). Despite their similar research aims, the differences in structure, phrasing, and context of their questions can make comparing their results a complex task.

## Compare the items in DASI and ASSIST

 Harmony is a sophisticated, yet user-friendly tool directed towards psychologists and social scientists that simplifies harmonisation, i.e., the process of matching items between different questionnaires. Its advanced AI can compare items not just between DASI and ASSIST, but between any set of instruments.
 
 
{{< card heading="Try Harmony" copy="Compare DASI and ASSIST " url="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app" >}}

{{< youtube cEZppTBj1NI >}}




Give the AI your instruments, and it provides a percentage match for each item, making "DASI vs ASSIST" comparisons painless and precise. Proving it's not just user-friendly but also quite convenient, Harmony permits researchers to upload their own questionnaires or choose from those available in the extensive Harmony database. The distinguishing feature that sets Harmony apart is its ability to handle multi-language comparisons, an asset when assimilating research from diverse linguistic demographics. With Harmony, "DASI vs ASSIST" becomes more than a comparison; it becomes a seamless fusion of two unique research mediums into one comprehensive, unified overview. Embark on a new stress-free research journey with Harmony, and make comparison queries like "DASI vs ASSIST" a relic of the past.
